body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as a banker in Bourbon County. Elected county sheriff in 1858 as a Know-Nothing candidate. Owned four slaves in 1860. During the war, Pullen was known as a conservative unionist. Committed suicide in 1885 by ingesting poison.

Spouses: Elizabeth F Pullen, Bettie Pullen
Children: Paulina W Pullen, Elizabeth A Pullen, Minnie F Pullen
